distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat Ceph Storage 2.1 that fix one security issue, multiple bugs, and add various enhancements. This erratum is applicable for Red Hat Ceph Storage that runs on RHEL 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Ceph Storage is a scalable, open, software-defined storage platform that combines the most stable version of the Ceph storage system with a Ceph management platform, deployment utilities, and support services.

The following packages have been upgraded to a newer upstream version: ceph (10.2.3), ceph-deploy (1.5.36), calamari-server (1.4.9), nfs-ganesha (2.4.0), ceph-iscsi-config (1.5), libntirpc (1.4.1), ceph-iscsi-tools (1.1). (BZ#1340004, BZ#1349999)

Security Fix(es):

* A flaw was found in the way Ceph Object Gateway handles POST object requests. An authenticated attacker could launch a denial of service attack by sending null or specially crafted POST object requests. (CVE-2016-8626)

Bug Fix(es) and Enhancement(s):

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Ceph
Storage 2.1 Release Notes available at:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en/red-hat-ceph-storage/2.1/single/release-notes/

All users of Red Hat Ceph Storage are advised to upgrade to these updated
packages.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat Ceph Storage security, bug fix, and enhancement update

rbd-mirror-1:10.2.3-13.el7cp.x86_64 as a component of Red Hat Ceph Storage Tools 2

notes.text: A flaw was found in the way Ceph Object Gateway handles POST object requests. An authenticated attacker could launch a denial of service attack by sending null or specially crafted POST object requests.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Ceph: RGW Denial of Service by sending null or specially crafted POST object requests
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: Ceph: RGW Denial of Service by sending null or specially crafted POST object requests
